Description: Rim sherd of East Greek pottery bowl; cream slip; glaze fired orange-red; interior glazed; exterior: painted decoration consisting of hound running to right (reserved head and neck remaining); at right, elaborate flower; blobs and group of short vertical strokes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Price 1924 pl. 7, no. 11; Kardara, C., 1963, Rodiake Aggeiographia, p. 249, 1.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 49)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.260)
